project.teaser: Geothermal fluids often carry high amounts of elements that the EU considers as 'critical' raw materials (CRM). Preliminary calculations show that even a single well has the potential to produce single-digit percentages of the EU needs. Combined extraction of heat and minerals...
project.objective: Geothermal fluids often carry high amounts of elements that the EU considers as 'critical' raw materials (CRM). Preliminary calculations show that even a single well has the potential to produce single-digit percentages of the EU needs. Combined extraction of heat and minerals maximises returns on investment, minimises environmental impact, requires no additional land use, leaves no mining legacies, has near-zero carbon footprint, and enables domestic supplies of CRM. To assess overall supply potential, CRM-geothermal will enlarge an existing geothermal fluid atlas by collecting new data and sampling wells for their CRM content in Europe and East Africa. The potential of different geological settings for combined extraction will be evaluated. Extraction/separation techniques exist, but need to be adapted to the harsh conditions of such systems (high temperature, pressure and salinities). Combinations of materials and flow-schemes will be assessed at lab-scale to optimise systems for different geothermal settings and CRM. A modular, mobile plant will be developed and deployed at existing geothermal sites to conduct pilot studies, investigating upscaling and system integration. The technological developments will be accompanied by assessments of environmental and social impacts to ensure good governance. An UNFC/UNRMS compliant reporting template will be developed to create trust among investors, regulators and the public. The project will advance key reference points for stakeholder engagement, in order to obtain and maintain a 'social license to operate'. Combined extraction creates new business opportunities for both SMEs and larger companies, and its economics under likely future market developments will be investigated with a view to proposing suitable business models. CRM-geothermal will open up a potentially huge untapped resource and deploy solutions to help Europe fulfil the strategic objectives of the EU Green Deal and the Agenda for Sustainable Development.
project.title: CRM-geothermal: Raw materials from geothermal fluids: occurrence, enrichment, extraction
project.keywords: Critical raw materials extraction, geothermal, CRM-Fluid-Atlas, ESG context, Social Licence to Operate

category.description: Article: Collections of results, from finished or nearly completed projects, focusing on a specific theme that you can apply in your domain

article.teaser: Europe depends upon critical raw materials to drive its transition to a low-carbon digital economy. To achieve this goal, it is essential to build public trust and understanding to secure access to these vital resources with minimal environmental damage. This new CORDIS Results Pack features seven EU-funded projects that reduce the impacts of locating and extracting critical raw materials.

result.title: Final Version of AI-based simulation module (software prototype)
result.description: Final Version of AI-based simulation module (software prototype): an agent-based framework utilizing various parameters of the extraction site (e.g., individual components of geological information, fluid composition, heat, permeability, brine chemistry).

result.title: Report identifying pre-existing sources of data at the selected sites
result.description: Report identifying pre-existing sources of data at the selected sites, for each of the 5 selectes geothermal areas. Input should be provided by Task 2.1-2.5.

result.title: The Horizon Europe CRM-geothermal project: Deliverable 7.6 – Data Management Plan
Guidelines for obtaining the Social Licenses to Operate (SLO) for combined extraction of CRM and energy
result.description: Guidelines for obtaining the Social Licenses to Operate (SLO) for combined extraction of CRM and energy. This includes (a) the definition of the drivers of resistance to and support for combined extraction projects and (b) recommendations for engagement with communities where combined extraction could be deployed.

result.title: Report on modified polymers as adsorbents and their effectiveness under geothermal conditions
result.description: Report on modified polymers as adsorbents and their effectiveness under geothermal conditions: (a) results from testing of adsorption behaviour, (b) results from experiments on optimal regeneration or recycling methods.

result.description: Update of the media kit with key messages from the project.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - CRM-geothermal (CRM-geothermal: Raw materials from geothermal fluids: occurrence, enrichment, extraction)
result.teaser: The energy and digital transitions require a large amount of mineral raw materials, some of which are considered ‘critical’ by the European Union. These Critical Raw Materials (CRM) are predominantly imported from non-European countries, where environmental and ethical...

result.title: CRM-geothermal video contest
result.description: A video contest for secondary school students will address the use of geothermal energy, the importance of CRM for our every-day life and the different faces of mining in Europe. The deliverable will report on the approach to the video contest and the outcomes (contributions and winning videos).

result.title: Report on the development of ion-exchange membranes and extraction fluids to selectively separate Li, Rb or Sr from geothermal brines
result.description: Results of analysis of the chemical composition, the thermomechanical properties, the structure and the electrical response of ion-exchange membranes. This also includes the results from testing different extraction fluids for ion separation.

result.description: Dissemination and Exploitation Plan, including Communication activities (first version). The plan will be updated in month 24 and 36.

result.title: Report on membrane-based gas extraction from brine
result.description: Report on membrane-based gas extraction from brine at various p-T- conditions using various membrane materials (commercially available polymer and silica-based membranes).This includes results from lab test in batch experiments as well as flow-through experiments using a coupled membrane test unit.

result.title: Project website
result.description: A website will be set up as a central hub for all outreach activities, providing up-to-date information about the project’s aim and current status

result.description: Data Management Plan: Including (i) types of data collected or generated, (ii) standards used, (iii) how data are curated and preserved and (iv) the relation to IPR requirements and exploitation strategies

result.title: Report on data obtained from literature review and existing databases included in the CRM-geothermal database

(3) Data from former Horizon 2020 geothermal projects, e.g. CHPM2030.

result.title: Numerical adsorption model for CRM extraction and sensitivity studies
result.description: Numerical adsorption model for CRM extraction and sensitivity studies: The model will reproduce the adsorption/desorption of 1-2 CRM with suitable adsorbents and include the coupling to thermal and fluid-mechanical processes to capture the dynamic behaviour of these processes.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
